newsitem.title: FRANCE: Govts should support Eurotunnel - Jospin.
newsitem.headline: Govts should support Eurotunnel - Jospin.

text.p: French Socialist leader Lionel Jospin has written to one of Eurotunnel SA /Plc's shareholder groups, saying the French and British governments have a key role to play in the company's debt restructuring.

"In any case, the shareholders must not be overlooked in discussions between the company and its bankers on the debt restructuring," Jospin said in a letter dated May 21 to Adacte, a Eurotunnel small shareholder association. "By the same token, in view of the scale of risk confronting the Channel Tunnel, the states cannot stay out of the situtation even if the operation has been granted to a private company," he said.

"The shareholders that you represent have effectively suffered a very heavy financial prejudice, all the more unacceptable in view of the financial outlook for Eurotunnel which appear to be positive," Jospin's letter said.
The Socialists and other left parties polled a surprise 40.1 percent in Sunday's parliamentary first-round ballot, leading the RPR-UDF and conservative parties' 36.5 percent.
A leading pollster, Roland Cayrol, director of the CSA, said on Monday the vote opened the possibility for a Socialist vistory in the second round to be held on June 1.

Eurotunnel is asking the French and British governments to extend its 60-year licence by as much as possible, seen essential in gaining shareholder approval for its plan to restructure 70 billion francs ($12.3 billion) of junior bank debt.
